channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China President Xi's European charm offensive turns to trade and 'fair competition' as he meets with France's Macron
item.description: As France prepares to host the Summer Olympics, Macron said he would ask Xi to use his influence to make the Games “a diplomatic moment of peace.”

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens
item.description: Here are the most important news items that investors need to start their trading day.

item.title: Democrats race to design ways to best use AI in 2024 campaign
item.description: The technology that could transform American elections — and perhaps threaten democracy itself.

item.title: U.S. automakers like GM are rapidly losing ground in China, once an engine for growth
item.description: GM's fall from grace in China is staggering amid geopolitical tensions with the U.S., along with changing consumer sentiment and increased domestic competition.

item.title: 'The Fall Guy' posts weak $28.5 million opening, providing Hollywood a lukewarm start to the summer movie season
item.description: The modest start for “The Fall Guy” hints at larger concerns for the film industry.

item.title: Monday's analyst calls: Micron a top pick, big gains ahead for steel stock after sell-off
item.description: A chipmaker and a steel giant were part of Monday's biggest analyst calls.

item.title: Former Trump campaign manager who used Cambridge Analytica to target Facebook ads in 2016 run has returned with his own AI platform
item.description: Brad Parscale, the digital campaign operative who helped engineer Trump’s 2016 presidential victory, vows that his new, AI-powered platform will dramatically overhaul not just polling, but campaigning.

item.title: Euro zone business activity grows at fastest pace in almost a year, PMI shows
item.description: Euro zone business activity expanded at its fastest pace in almost a year last month as a resurgence in the bloc's dominant services industry more than offset a deeper downturn in manufacturing, a survey showed on Monday.

item.title: Starbucks ex-CEO Howard Schultz says chain needs a major fix after biggest sales miss in years: 'There must be contrition'
item.description: Shares plummeted after sales dropped this month for the first time since the early days of Covid in 2020.

item.title: U.S. wins global leadership approval over China when a Democrat is president, Gallup analysis shows
item.description: Most countries prefer aligning with the U.S. over China when the White House is occupied by a Democratic leader, according to Gallup data going back to 2007.
